availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Smith. Married to Eliza A. Gardner Smith in Clark County, Kentucky, on January 15, 1824. Married to Drucilla Stipp Smith in Clark County on August 10, 1830. Father of Thomas C. Smith, Mary E. Smith, John D. Smith, Evaline Smith, Sarah A. Smith, Louisa P. Smith, Benjamin H. Smith, and William F. Smith. Married to Mary Young Smith in Clark County on June 13, 1865. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Enslaved twenty people in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Enslaved twenty-eight people in Clark County in 1860.
